info.author: Michael Kluge
info.description: SPRING is a reference-free method to compress high throughput sequencing data
info.paperDescription: The FASTQ files were compressed using SPRING.

param.name: fastq
param.description: path to one or two (PE datasets) fastq files; possible endings: *.fastq, *.fq, *.fastq.gz or *.fq.gz file

param.name: spring
param.description: path to compressed spring file; possible endings: *.spring or *.tar

param.name: compress
param.description: if true the fastq files are compressed; otherwise the spring file is decompressed

param.name: qualityMode
param.description: possible values: 'lossless', 'qvz qv_ratio', 'ill_bin' or 'binary thr high low'

param.name: long
param.description: use for compression of arbitrarily long reads

param.name: decompressRange
param.description: decompress only reads (or read pairs for PE datasets) from start to end (both inclusive); e.g. '1 100'

var.name: createdFile
var.description: path to the compressed or decompressed file (separated by ',' in case of PE datasets)

var.name: isPairedEnd
var.description: true if paired-end data was processed
